Figure 1:A multi-turn code generation example with four public test cases (two correct and two incorrect) and 16 hidden test cases.
The LLM starts with the coding problem and generates a program.
It passes all benign public tests and hidden tests, while failing the two perturbed tests.
As a result,one of the failedtest case is returned as feedback.
All other test cases and their pass rates are hidden.
The LLM mistakenly follows the feedback and changes its program, which now passes the perturbed test case but only one hidden test case.
